title: Rotation - Torque exerted on swinging rod

content.question: A uniform rod of mass <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is free to rotate about a pivot at its left end and is released from rest when the rod is <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mo>°</mo></math> below the horizontal, as shown in the figure. With respect to the pivot, the rod has rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub 0, equals one third, times M sub 0, end sub, times L squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly represents the magnitude of the net torque exerted on the rod about the pivot at the moment the rod is released?
